description: For a rational number p/q let f(p/q) = p*q divided by (the sum of digits of p and of q) minus 1; a(n) is obtained by iterating f, starting at n/1, until an integer is reached, or if no integer is ever reached then a(n) = 0.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
prog: (Haskell)import Data.Ratio ((%), numerator, denominator)a059514 n = f [n % 1] where   f xs@(x:_)     | denominator y == 1 = numerator y     | y `elem` xs        = 0     | otherwise          = f (y : xs)     where y = (numerator x * denominator x) %               (a007953 (numerator x) + a007953 (denominator x) - 1)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 11 2013
author: _Floor van Lamoen_, Jan 22 2001
extensions: Corrected and extended by _Naohiro Nomoto_, Jul 20 2001
